## Key Findings Summary

### AI Video Tools (Feb 2026 Landscape)
- **No tool generates 20+ min video directly.** All require clip-by-clip (5-10s) + FFmpeg assembly.
- **Top API-accessible models**: Sora 2 (~$0.10/sec), Kling 3.0 (~$0.05/sec via proxies), Veo 3.1 (Vertex AI), Minimax Hailuo 2.3, Runway Gen-4.5
- **Best open source**: WAN 2.1 (Alibaba, Apache 2.0, runs on 8GB VRAM for 1.3B model)
- **Character consistency leaders**: Kling 3.0 (multi-element), Luma Ray 3.14 (cref), Sora 2 (Cameos)

### The Proven Production Formula for 20-min Videos
- **~200 visual shots needed** per 20-min video
- **Hybrid strategy** (universally adopted by Chinese/Russian/English communities):
  - 50-60% Ken Burns on AI images (cheap, fast, reliable)
  - 20-30% AI video clips for key action scenes
  - 10-20% B-roll, effects, text overlays
- This cuts cost 60%+ vs generating AI video for every shot

### Cost Estimates
- **Budget**: ~$15-30/video (Edge TTS + Gemini free images + Kling via proxy)
- **Mid-range**: ~$50-100/video (Fish Audio + Flux images + multi-model video)
- **Premium**: ~$150-400/video (ElevenLabs + Midjourney + Sora 2)
- **Monthly at 1/day budget**: ~$570/mo; quality: ~$1,150/mo

### Batch Production Techniques
- Parallel API generation with asyncio semaphore (10 concurrent clips)
- Multi-candidate generation (2-3 per shot, auto-select best)
- Template-based production for recurring formats
- Fliki-style spreadsheet-to-video bulk creation

### TTS Recommendation
- **Budget**: Edge TTS (free, 80+ languages, word timestamps)
- **Best value**: Fish Audio (90-95% cheaper than ElevenLabs, 15s voice cloning, REST API)
- **Premium**: ElevenLabs ($99/mo for 100 min)

### 5 Immediate Wins for This Project
1. Add WAN 2.1 (open source) to Stage 11 for zero-cost non-critical shots
2. Multi-model routing (route shots to optimal model based on content type)
3. Parallel clip generation in Stage 10 (currently sequential)
4. Fish Audio integration for premium narration at low cost
5. Multi-candidate generation with automated quality scoring

### 9 Unresolved Questions listed at end of report (API rate limits, YouTube monetization risks, pricing gaps, etc.)

Report is 14 sections, ~700 lines, comprehensive coverage across English and Russian sources.
